member.name: T:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI
member.summary: TMcraftNodeAPI is the main class of the TMcraft API that creates a connection between the Node UI and TMflow. In addition, it contains different member (or provider) functions in order to interact with TMflow, such as creating Project variables and jogging the robot.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.Version
member.summary: A member of the TMcraftNodeAPI class. A const string represents the version of the current TMcraft.dll and is read-only.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.VariableProvider
member.summary: VariableProvider provides functions for TMcraft to access or modify the variables of the robot.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.PointProvider
member.summary: PointProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access or modify Point values within the current project.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.RobotStatusProvider
member.summary: RobotStatusProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access different robot status information.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.BaseProvider
member.summary: BaseProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access or modify the base value of the current Project.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.DataStorageProvider
member.summary: DataStorageProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access its own temporarily stored data for configuration purposes, for example). Please note that a TMflow project can contain a single TMcraft Node in duplicate, and these nodes do not share their own data with each another. TMcraft API ensures each node accesses its own temporarily stored data, depending on the identity/location of the node.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.IOProvider
member.summary: IOProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to interact with system I/O.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.TCPProvider
member.summary: TcpProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access or modify TCPs with the robot.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.VisionProvider
member.summary: VisionProvider provides functions for TMcraft node to access or interact with the vision jobs of the current Project.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.RobotJogProvider
member.summary: RobotJogProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to jog the robot, either by commands or the Controller Interface.

member.name: P:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.SystemProvider
member.summary: SystemProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to interact with TMflow System Settings.

member.name: M:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.Close
member.summary: Closes the current TMcraft node.
member.returns: If the function works properly, it returns TMcraftErr.OK; otherwise, the corresponding TMcraftErr. For more details, please check enum TMcraft.TMcraftErr.

member.name: M:TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI.GetErrMsg(System.UInt32,System.String@)
member.summary: Return the error message according to the error code input. This function is used for checking the result of calling Provider functions.
member.param: The unit error code returned by most Provider functions.
The output error message that refers to the input error code.
member.returns: If the function works properly, it returns TMcraftErr.OK; otherwise, the corresponding TMcraftErr. For more details, please check enum TMcraft.TMcraftErr.

member.name: T:TMcraft.ScriptWriteProvider
member.summary: ScriptWriteProvider class can be compared to a container of TMscript that is usually used within TMcraftNodeEntry.InscribeScript (), so that the TMscript can be implemented in the current Project when the Node UI is closed.

member.name: M:TMcraft.ScriptWriteProvider.AppendLine(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a line of script through auto-indentation (i.e., a newline followed by a scriptLine) after the script on the ScriptWriteProvider Type.
member.param: Script being added with auto-indentation.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.ScriptWriteProvider.AppendScript(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a script code (without auto-indentation) to the back of the script on the ScriptWriteProvider Type.
member.param: Script being added without auto-indentation.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.ScriptWriteProvider.GetScript
member.summary: Gets the script from the ScriptWriteProvider object .
member.returns: Script from the ScriptWriteProvider object.

member.name: T:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider
member.summary: DataStorageProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access its own temporarily stored data for configuration purposes, for example). Please note that a TMflow project can contain a single TMcraft Node in duplicate, and these nodes do not share their own data with each another. TMcraft API ensures each node accesses its own temporarily stored data, depending on the identity/location of the node.

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Saves a DictionaryType (a collection of string keys and string data). Please note that this dictionary of data belongs to the current TMcraft Node only.
member.param: A Dictionary Type of data stored within the current node.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a string data, along with its string key. Please note that this data belongs to the current TMcraft Node only.
member.param: A string key that provides access to its corresponding data.
String data being stored.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.String,TMcraft.BaseInfo)
member.summary: Saves a BaseInfo type data, along with its corresponding string key. Please note that this data belongs to the current TMcraft Node only.
member.param: A string key that provides access to its corresponding data.
BaseInfo data being stored.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,TMcraft.BaseInfo})
member.summary: Saves a Dictionary Type, along with string keys and BaseInfo data it contains. Please note that this dictionary of data belongs to the current TMcraft Node only.
member.param: A Dictionary type of data stored within the current node.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.String,TMcraft.PointInfo)
member.summary: Save a PointInfo type data, along with its corresponding string key. Please note that this data belongs to the current TMcraft node only.
member.param: A string key that provides access to its corresponding data.
PointInfo type data being stored.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.SaveData(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,TMcraft.PointInfo})
member.summary: Saves a Dictionary Type that is defined by string keys and PointInfo data. Please note that this dictionary of data belongs to the current TMcraft node only.
member.param: A Dictionary type of data stored within the current node.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.GetData(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets a string data, along with its corresponding string key. Please note that this data belongs to the current TMcraft node only.
member.param: A string key that provides access to its corresponding data.
String type data being output.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.GetData(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object}@)
member.summary: Gets a Dictionary Type of data set, which correspondings to a certain List of string keys, from the current TMcraft Node.
member.param: A List of string keys that can provide access to several data stored within the current node.
Dictionary <string, object> being output.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.GetData(System.String,TMcraft.BaseInfo@)
member.summary: Gets a specific BaseInfo type data from the current TMcraft node data storage according to the string key.
member.param: A string key that provides access to the data.
BaseInfo type data being output.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.GetData(System.String,TMcraft.PointInfo@)
member.summary: Gets a specific PointInfo type data from the current TMcraft node data storage according to the string key.
member.param: A string key that provides access to the data.
PointInfo type data being output.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.DataStorageProvider.GetAllData(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object}@)
member.summary: Gets all data (Dictionary Type) from the current TMcraft node data storage.
member.param: A Dictionary type of all data stored within the current node.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: T:TMcraft.VariableProvider
member.summary: VariableProvider provides functions for TMcraft to access or modify the variables of the robot.

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.GetGlobalVariableList(System.Collections.Generic.List{TMcraft.VariableInfo}@)
member.summary: Gets all Global Variables (VariableInfo Type) from the robot and overwrites the input List.
member.param: A List of Variable Info type that contains all global variables within the robot.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.CreateProjectVariable(System.String,TMcraft.VariableType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Project Variable to the current Project, according to the input parameters.
member.param: Name of the variable being created.
Type of variable being created.
Value being assigned to the new variable.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.CreateGlobalVariable(System.String,TMcraft.VariableType,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Global Variable, according to the input parameters.
member.param: Name of the variable being created.
Type of variable being created.
Value being assigned to the new variable.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.ChangeProjectVariableValue(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String[]})
member.summary: Sets the initial value of a specific Project Variables.
member.param: A list of Project Variables being modified; each element within this list should be a 2×1 string array {varName, varValue}, where varName is the name of the target variable while varValue is the value being assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.ChangeGlobalVariableValue(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String[]})
member.summary: Sets the value of a specific Global Variables.
member.param: A list of global variables being modified; each element within this list should be a 2×1 string array {varName, varValue}, where varName is the name of the target variable and varValue is the value being assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.DeleteProjectVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a specific Local Variable from the current TMflow Project.
member.param: Name of the local variable being deleted.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.DeleteGlobalVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a specific Global Variable from the robot.
member.param: Name of the global variable being deleted.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.IsProjectVariableExist(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a specific Project Variable exists or not.
member.param: Name of the Project Variable being checked.
member.returns: True if exists, false if not.

member.name: M:TMcraft.VariableProvider.IsGlobalVariableExist(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a specific Global Variable exists or not.
member.param: Name of the Global Variable being checked.
member.returns: True if exists, false if not.

member.name: T:TMcraft.PointProvider
member.summary: PointProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access or modify Point values within the current project.

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.GetPointList(System.Collections.Generic.List{TMcraft.PointInfo}@)
member.summary: Gets the Point list of the current Project.
member.param: A List of PointInfo objects that represents the list of points of the current Project.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.GetPointRobotConfigs(System.String,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Gets the Robot Configs of a specific Point.
member.param: Name of the target point.

A 3×1 interger array representing the robot configurations of the target point. Here is the definition:
int[0]: 0 – Right Arm, 1 – Left Arm
int[1]: 2 – Above Elbow, 3 – Below Elbow
int[2]: 4 – Up Wrist, 5 – Down Wrist
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.ChangePointRobotConfigs(System.String,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Sets the Robot Configs of the specific Point.
member.param: Name of the target point.

A 3×1 interger array representing the robot configurations of the target point. Here is the definition:
int[0]: 0 – Right Arm, 1 – Left Arm
int[1]: 2 – Above Elbow, 3 – Below Elbow
int[2]: 4 – Up Wrist, 5 – Down Wrist>
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.CreatePointByFlangeCoordinates(System.String,System.Single[],System.Int32[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Point defined by Flange Coordinates (and by Point Name, Robot Configs, Base Name, and Tool Name).
member.param: Name of the Point being created.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz}, represents the Flange Coordinates defining the new point.

A 3×1 interger array representing the robot configurations of the target point. Here is the definition:
int[0]: 0 – Right Arm, 1 – Left Arm
int[1]: 2 – Above Elbow, 3 – Below Elbow
int[2]: 4 – Up Wrist, 5 – Down Wrist
The base, which defines the flange, coordinates.
The tool, which defines the point.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.CreatePointByToolCoordinates(System.String,System.Single[],System.Int32[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Point defined by end-effector Coordinates (and by Point Name, Robot Configs, Base Name, and Tool Name).
member.param: Name of the point created.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz}, represents the end-effector Coordinates defining the new point.

A 3×1 interger array representing the robot configurations of the target point. Here is the definition:
int[0]: 0 – Right Arm, 1 – Left Arm
int[1]: 2 – Above Elbow, 3 – Below Elbow
int[2]: 4 – Up Wrist, 5 – Down Wrist
The base which defines the end-effector coordinates.
The tool which defines the end-effector coordinates.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.CreatePointByJointAngles(System.String,System.Single[],System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Point defined by 6 Joint Angles (and by Point Name, Base Name, and Tool Name).
member.param: Name of the point being created.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz}, represents the Joint Angles defining the new point.
The base which defines the point.
The tool which defines the point.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling.

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.ChangePointToolCoordinates(System.String,System.Single[])
member.summary: Changes the Tool Coordinates of a specific Point.
member.param: Name of the target point.
A 6×1 float array {x, y,z, rx, ry, rz} which represents the new Tool Coordinates.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.ChangePointBase(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the base of a specific Point.
member.param: Name of the target point.
Name of the Base being switched to.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.PointProvider.IsPointExist(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a specific Point exists or not.
member.param: Name of the point being checked.
member.returns: True if exists, false if not.

member.name: T:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider
member.summary: RobotStatusProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to access different robot status information.

member.name: E:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.EndButtonClickEvent
member.summary: An event type denotes to the click event occurred on the buttons of the End Module, which Sets FreeBot settings. Function can be linked to this event so that it will be activated once the event is triggered.

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetCurrentPoseByRobotBase(System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets robot current TCP position defined by the Robot Base.
member.param: A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that denotes the current robot pose.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetCurrentPoseByCurrentBase(System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets robot current TCP position defined by the Current Base.
member.param: A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that denotes the current robot pose.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetCurrentPoseByJointAngle(System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets all robot current Joint Angles.
member.param: A 6×1 float array {j1, j2, j3, j4, j5, j6} that represents the current robot pose.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetCurrentRobotConfigs(System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Gets current Robot Config.
member.param:
A 3×1 interger array representing the robot configurations of the target point. Here is the definition:
int[0]: 0 – Right Arm, 1 – Left Arm
int[1]: 2 – Above Elbow, 3 – Below Elbow
int[2]: 4 – Up Wrist, 5 – Down Wrist
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.summary: Assigns a specific Base as the current base.

member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.summary: Gets the name of the current Base.
member.param: Current Base name.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.summary: Gets the name of current TCP.
member.param: Current TCP name.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.summary: Assigns a specific TCP as the current TCP.

member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.summary: Sets a payload value to the robot (end-effector).
member.param: Payload value being assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetCurrentPayload(System.Single@)
member.summary: Gets a payload value to the robot (end-effector).
member.param: Payload value being assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotStatusProvider.GetFreeBot(TMcraft.FreeBotInfo@)
member.summary: Gets the value of the current FreeBot settings.
member.param: Value of the current FreeBot settings defined by FreeBotInfo.

member.summary: Sets FreeBot setting

A 6×1 float array, {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz}, that can be the new value of the target Base.

member.name: T:TMcraft.IOProvider
member.summary: IOProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to interact with system I/O.

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.GetAllIOData(System.Collections.Generic.List{TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo}@)
member.summary: Gets all IO status.
member.param: A List of DeviceIOInfo objects that represents all IO status data.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.WriteDigitOutput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Change the status of a specific Digital Output.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target digital output belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Digital Output status, where bool true is HIGH and bool false is LOW.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.SetCameraLight(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Switch the Eye-In-Hand camera light to the ON or OFF status.
member.param: bool true means turning the light ON, bool false means turning the light OFF
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.ReadDigitInput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Read the status of a specific Digital Input.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target Digital Input belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Digital Input status, where bool true is HIGH and bool false is LOW.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling.

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.ReadDigitOutput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Read the status of a specific Digital Output.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target Digital Output belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Digital Input status, where bool true is HIGH and bool false is LOW.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling.

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.ReadAnalogInput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single@)
member.summary: Read the status of a specific Analog Input.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target Analog Input belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Analog Input value, ranged from -10V to 10V.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling.

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.ReadAnalogOutput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single@)
member.summary: Read the status of a specific Analog Output.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target Analog Output belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Analog Output value, ranged from -10V to 10V.

member.name: M:TMcraft.IOProvider.WriteAnalogOutput(TMcraft.IO_TYPE,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Set the value of a specific Analog Output.
member.param: The IO_TYPE enum that defines which device the target Analog Output belongs to.

Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there are only one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.
Channel number.
Analog Output value, ranged from -10V to 10V.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling.

member.summary: Modifies the mass value (kg) of a specific TCP.

Mass value (kg) to be assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.GetTcpInertia(System.String,System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets the inertia value of a specific TCP.
member.param: Name of the target TCP.
A 3×1 float array {Ixx, Iyy, Izz} that represents the inertia value of the target TCP.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.ChangeTcpInertia(System.String,System.Single[])
member.summary: Modifies the inertia value of a specific TCP.
member.param: Name of the target TCP.
A 3×1 float array {Ixx, Iyy, Izz} of inertia value being assigned.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.GetTcpMassCenter(System.String,System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets the Mass Center value of a specific TCP.
member.param: Name of the target TCP.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that represents the location of the mass center of the TCP.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.ChangeTcpMassCenter(System.String,System.Single[])
member.summary: Modifies the Mass Center value of a specific TCP.
member.param: Name of the target TCP.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that represents the location of the mass center of the TCP.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.DeleteTcp(System.String)
member.summary: Delete a specific TCP file.
member.param: Name of the TCP being deleted.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.TCPProvider.IsTcpExist(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a specific tcp exists or not.
member.param: Name of the tcp being checked.
member.returns: True if exists, false if not.

member.name: T:TMcraft.VisionProvider
member.summary: VisionProvider provides functions for TMcraft node to access or interact with the vision jobs of the current Project.

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.GetVisionJobList(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@)
member.summary: Gets the list of Vision Job from the current Project.
member.param: List of vision jobs.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.GetVisionJobInitialPoint(System.String,System.Single[]@)
member.summary: Gets the initial Point coordinates of a specific Vision Job.
member.param: Name of the target vision job.
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that represents the initial Point coordinates of the target Vision Job.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.GetVisionJobInitialBase(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the name of the initial Base of a specific Vision Job.
member.param: Name of the target vision job.
Name of the initial base of the target Vision Job.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.CreateVisionJob(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Vision Job and opens it with the Vision Designer Interface.
member.param: Name of the target vision job being created.

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.DeleteVisionJob(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a specific Vision Job.
member.param: Name of the target vision job being deleted.

member.name: M:TMcraft.VisionProvider.OpenVisionJob(System.String)
member.summary: Opens a specific Vision Job with the Vision Designer Interface.
member.param: Name of the target vision job being opened.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: T:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider
member.summary: RobotJogProvider provides functions for TMcraft Node to jog the robot, either by commands or the Controller Interface.

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider.JogByJoint(System.Single,System.Single[])
member.summary: Jogs the robot towards the targets Joint Angles. Please note that like using TMflow Controller, the user needs to use the Robot Stick (e.g., by pressing the Enabling Switch and the PLAY button) to start the motion.
member.param: Speed percentage is equivalent to the speed (percentage) setting on the TMflow Controller, where the actual jogging speed should be equal to the maximum joint speed. The maximum joint speed of the robot model is multiplied by the speed percentage, and the product (TCP speed) of this multiplication should always be lower than Manual Control mode speed limit (250 mm/s). speedPercentage is expressed in decimals (e.g., 1.5 for 1.5%).
A 6×1 float array {J1, J2, J3, J4, J5, J6} which represents the target Joint Angle.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider.JogRelativeByTool(System.Single,System.Single[])
member.summary: Jogs the robot along with Tool Axes. Remind that, like using TMflow Controller, user needs to use the robot stick (e.g. Enabling Device + PLAY) to start the motion.
member.param: Speed percentage is equivalent to the speed (percentage) setting on the TMflow Controller, where the actual jogging speed should be equal to the maximum joint speed. The maximum joint speed of the robot model is multiplied by the speed percentage, and the product (TCP speed) of this multiplication should be always lower than Manual Control mode speed limit (250 mm/s).speedPercentage is expressed in decimals (e.g., 1.5 for 1.5%).
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry ,rz} of target movement value.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider.JogByBase(System.Single,System.Single[])
member.summary: Jogs the robot towards the target’s Coordinates (relative to current base and tool) with a 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry ,rz}.
member.param: Speed percentage is equivalent to the speed (percentage) setting on the TMflow Controller, where the actual jogging speed should be equal to the maximum join speed. The maximum joint speed of the robot model is multiplied by the speed percentage, and the product (TCP speed) of this multiplication should always be lower than Manual Control mode speed limit (250 mm/s). speedPercentage is expressed in decimals (e.g., 1.5 for 1.5%).
A 6×1 float array {x, y, z, rx, ry ,rz} of target movement value.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider.StopJog
member.summary: Stop all Jog motion immediately.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: M:TMcraft.RobotJogProvider.OpenControllerPanel
member.summary: Open TMflow Controller Interface.
member.returns: The error code that represents the result of the function calling

member.name: T:TMcraft.VariableInfo
member.summary: VariableInfo, paired with VariableProvider functions such as GetGlobalVariableList(), describes all the information of a variable.

member.name: P:TMcraft.VariableInfo.Name
member.summary: Name of the variable.

member.name: P:TMcraft.VariableInfo.Type
member.summary: Variable type of the variable.

member.name: P:TMcraft.VariableInfo.value
member.summary: Value of the variable.

member.name: P:TMcraft.VariableInfo.IsGlobal
member.summary: True if it is a global variable; false if it is a project variable.

member.name: T:TMcraft.TMCDataStruct
member.summary: TM Data Struct for editing node initial data.

member.name: T:TMcraft.DigitIOInfo
member.summary: DigitIOInfo describes the information of a Digital I/O channel which is used as the List data type of DeviceIOinfo.DICollection and DeviceIOInfo.DOCollection.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DigitIOInfo.Value
member.summary: True denotes HIGH while false denotes LOW.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DigitIOInfo.IsUserDefined
member.summary: True denotes this Digital Channel is set as a User-Defined IO (that triggers a signal to a button of the Robot Stick, reads the signal from a stick button, or detects if an error occurs in the system).

member.name: T:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo
member.summary: The DeviceIOInfo describes all sorts of information related to a specific IO Device of the robot.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.Type
member.summary: IO device that this information describes.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.deviceSerialNum
member.summary: Device serial number, which always starts from 0 and is more meaningful if the target device is an external IO module because there might be multiple external IO module devices within the system. The number is 0 if the target device is the Control box IO board or end module IO board because there is always one Control box IO board and one end module IO board.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.DICollection
member.summary: A List of DigitIOInfo Type, which represents all Digital Inputs within the IO Device and should be empty if there are no Digital Inputs. Please note that the index of the list represents the channel number.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.DOCollection
member.summary: A List of DigitIOInfo Type that represents all Digital Outputs within the IO Device and should be empty if there are no Digital Ouputs. Please note that the index of the list represents the channel number.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.AOCollection
member.summary: A List of float Type that represents all Analog Outputs within the IO Device and should be empty if there are no Analog Ouputs. Please note that the index of the list represents the channel number.

member.name: F:TMcraft.DeviceIOInfo.AICollection
member.summary: A List of float Typethat represents all Analog Inputs within the IO Device and should be empty if there are no Analog Inputs. Please note that the index of the list represents the channel number.

member.name: T:TMcraft.IO_TYPE
member.summary: Enum IO_TYPE, paired with IOProvider functions such as WriteDigitOutput(), defines the IO device within TM robot.

member.name: F:TMcraft.IO_TYPE.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Represents an unknown device detected. When using IOProvider.GetAllIOData(), if there is any unknown device detected, IO_TYPE.UNKNOWN will be found within the DeviceIOInfo data

member.name: F:TMcraft.IO_TYPE.CONTROL_BOX
member.summary: Control Box I/O.

member.name: F:TMcraft.IO_TYPE.END_MODULE
member.summary: End Module I/O (Tool End I/O Interface).

member.name: F:TMcraft.IO_TYPE.EXT_MODULE
member.summary: External I/O Device(s) connected to the robot.

member.name: T:TMcraft.DigitalIOInfo
member.summary: Digital IO Information

member.name: T:TMcraft.AnalogIOInfo
member.summary: Analog IO Information

member.name: T:TMcraft.ITMcraftNodeEntry
member.summary: ITMcraftNodeEntry is an Interface provided by TMcraft API which defines a contract of being a TMcraft Node. Any class that implements this contract must provide an implementation of two members defined in the Interface: InitializeNode() and InscribeScript().

member.name: M:TMcraft.ITMcraftNodeEntry.InitializeNode(TMcraft.TMcraftNodeAPI)
member.summary: Initializes the Node with user-defined actions.
member.param: The TMcraftNodeAPI object connects the TMcraft Node with TMflow.

member.name: M:TMcraft.ITMcraftNodeEntry.InscribeScript(TMcraft.ScriptWriteProvider)
member.summary: This function is executed when TMcraft node is about to close and actions can be defined within it. Usually, the major action is using ScriptWriteProvider functions to define the script being executed during project run. Please note that the previously saved script will be cleared before the latest defined script is inscribed.
member.param: A ScriptWriteProvider Object, which is used for calling AppendLine() or AppendScript().

member.name: M:TMcraft.DeviceCommandManager.GetMessagesFrom
member.summary: Start Push Notification listen

member.name: T:TMcraft.TCPInfo
member.summary: TCPInfo, which describes the basic information of a TCP, is the element type of the output List of TCPProvider.GetTcpList.().

member.name: F:TMcraft.TCPInfo.name
member.summary: Name of the TCP.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TCPInfo.data
member.summary: Tool Center Point, which defines a float[6] {x, y, z, Rx, Ry, Rz} relative to the Flange base.

member.name: T:TMcraft.BaseInfo
member.summary: BaseInfo, which describes the information of a base, is the element typeof the output List of BaseProvider.GetBaseList().

member.name: F:TMcraft.BaseInfo.name
member.summary: Name of the base.

member.name: F:TMcraft.BaseInfo.data
member.summary: A 6×1 float array, {x, y, z, rx, ry, rz} that defines the base.

member.name: F:TMcraft.BaseInfo.type
member.summary: Type of the base, such as R (Robot Base), C (Custom Base) and V (Vision Base).

member.name: F:TMcraft.BaseInfo.number
member.summary: The serial number of the base within its base type; the robot base is always 0, while the other base types always start from 1.

member.name: T:TMcraft.PointInfo
member.summary: PointInfo, which describes the information of a Point (robot pose) within the current Project, is the element type of the output List of PointProvider.GetBaseList(). Note that a robot pose can be defined by three kinds of coordinates: flange coordinates, joint angles and tool coordinates.

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.pointName
member.summary: Name of the point.

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.flangeCoordinate
member.summary: Flange Coordinates that defines this point (robot pose).

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.endToolCoordinate
member.summary: Tool coordinates of this robot pose.

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.jointAngles
member.summary: Joint Angles that defines this point (robot pose).

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.baseName
member.summary: The base that defines this point (robot pose).

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.toolName
member.summary: Tool that defines the tool coordinates of this point.

member.name: F:TMcraft.PointInfo.pointType
member.summary: There are two possible point types: R (Regular) and D (Dynamic). The Regular point is a point generated with Point node, while the Dynamic point is a point generated with Touch Stop node.

member.name: T:TMcraft.RobotEventType
member.summary: Enum RobotEventType, paired with IO_TYPE and RobotStatusProvider’s event EndButtonClickEvent, defines the click event occurred on the buttons of the End Module.

member.name: F:TMcraft.RobotEventType.EndButtonGripperChanged
member.summary: Represents the click event of the Gripper Buttoon on the End Module. True denotes the button is pressed while False denotes that pressing is released.

member.name: F:TMcraft.RobotEventType.EndButtonPointChanged
member.summary: Represents the click event of the Point Buttoon on the End Module. True denotes the button is pressed while False denotes that pressing is released.

member.name: F:TMcraft.RobotEventType.EndButtonVisionChanged
member.summary: Represents the click event of the Vision Buttoon on the End Module. True denotes the button is pressed while False denotes that pressing is released.

member.name: T:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo
member.summary: FreeBotInfo describes the information of FreeRobot Configuration PointInfo and applies to 2 of the RobotStatusProvider functions, GetFreeBot() and SetFreeBot. Note that if the Mode is not Custom, the rest of the members is meaningless.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isBaseMode
member.summary: True means FreeBot Custom settings being defined by the current base; false means FreeBot Custom settings being defined by the current tool base.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeRX
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed Rx axis or not.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeRY
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed Ry axis or not.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeRZ
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed Rz axis or not.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeX
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed X axis or not.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeY
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed Y axis or not.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.isFreeZ
member.summary: Represents if the current FreeBot Custom Setting has freed Z axis or not

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotInfo.Mode
member.summary: Represents the current Freebot mode.

member.name: T:TMcraft.FreeBotMode
member.summary: Enum FreeBotMode, which is used as a member of the class FreeBotInfo and represents the current FreeBot mode.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotMode.All_Joints
member.summary: Represents that the robot is currenly set as FreeBot with all joints.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotMode.Custom
member.summary: Represents that the robot is currenly set as FreeBot with custom settings.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotMode.RXYZ
member.summary: Represents that the robot is currenly set as Freebot with Rx, Ry and Rz.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotMode.SCARA_Like
member.summary: Represents that the robot is currenly set as SCARA-like FreeBot.

member.name: F:TMcraft.FreeBotMode.XYZ
member.summary: Represents that the robot is currenly set as Freebot with X, Y and Z.

member.name: T:TMcraft.TMcraftErr
member.summary: Enum TMcraftErr represents the possible error that may occurred not from TMflow, but TMcraft API itself. TMcraftErr is used as the object type returned by the functions TMcraftNodeAPI functions.

member.name: T:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.ConnectionFail
member.summary: TMcraft API failed to connect with TMflow.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.DevResponseError
member.summary: Unexpected error on TMcraft API. Please contact Techman Inc. for further analysis.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.ExceptionError
member.summary: Exception happended on TMcraft API. Please contact Techman Inc. for further analysis.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.InvalidParameter
member.summary: TMcraft API detects invalid parameters when calling provider functions. For example, empty string or incorrect array size.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.NodeCloseFail
member.summary: Failure happened when closing TMcraft Node on TMflow.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMcraftErr.OK
member.summary: No error.

member.name: T:TMcraft.TMflowType
member.summary: Enum TMflowType, which is the output of GetTMflowType() and represent the TMflow type of the current system, or more specifically, of where the GetTMflowType function is called.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMflowType.AOIEdge
member.summary: Represents that the current system is AOI Edge.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMflowType.Client
member.summary: Represents that the current system is client TMflow.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMflowType.OLP
member.summary: Represents that the current system is TMstudio Pro.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMflowType.Robot
member.summary: Represents that the current system is on the robot.

member.name: F:TMcraft.TMflowType.Unknown
member.summary: Represents that the current system is not recognizable as one of the TMflow type.

member.name: T:TMcraft.TmfCommand
member.summary: Result of calling most of the TMcraft API functions, which return TMError.OK if a function work successfully. The rest of TMError items are also equivalent to TMflow error codes (although the former are expressed the decimal format).
